rubiaceae: A family of flowering plants characterized by their adaptability to thrive in a wide range of environments, often flourishing in sandy soils and humid conditions, and typically displaying small, delicate flowers that are frequently overlooked by the human eye, yet play a vital role in shaping ecosystems.
A family of flowering plants characterized by their vibrant colors and adaptability to environments with fluctuating water levels, often thriving in temporarily flooded areas with sandy substrates.

A family of flowering plants that thrive in warm and humid environments, often characterized by their ability to adapt to sandy and temporarily flooded soils, while being absent from or newly introduced to certain regions of the world.

A family of flowering plants typically found in warm and humid environments, characterized by their ability to thrive in well-drained soils and tolerate periodic waterlogging, with species often exhibiting adaptability to a range of habitats.

A family of flowering plants commonly found in tropical regions, characterized by their robust growth and affinity for fertile, moist soils, with some members having the ability to thrive in environments with periodic flooding.
A tropical, rubiaceous plant species characterized by its ability to thrive in temporarily flooded environments with sandy soils, having previously been restricted to non-European regions but has now been discovered and recorded in Spain.
